Member Function Documentation
Apply()[1/4] ApplyPhoton.Compression.ElementCrusher Photon.Compression.ElementCrusherApply
void Photon.Compression.ElementCrusher.Apply (Rigidbody rb, CompressedElement ce, IncludedAxes ia = IncludedAxes.XYZ )
Applies only the enabled axes to the transform, leaving the disabled axes untouched.
Parameters
ia
The indicated axis will be used (assuming they are enabled for the crusher). For example if an object only moves up and down in place, IncludedAxes.Y would only apply the Y axis compression values, and would leave the X and Z values as they currently are.

static ElementCrusher Photon.Compression.ElementCrusher.CheckAgainstStatics (ElementCrusher ec, bool CheckAgainstFloatCrushersAsWell = true )[static]
Checks to see if a crusher with the same settings has been registered with our dictionary.
If a crusher with the same value exists there, that crusher is returned. If no duplicate of of the supplied crusher exists, the supplied crusher is returned.

CompressedElement Photon.Compression.ElementCrusher.Compress (Element e)
Compress an Element (Vector/Quaternion wrapper) and return as a CompressedElement.
WARNING: The returned CompressedElement is recycled and its values need to be used immediately.
Supply a pre-allocated CompressedElement as an argument if you intend to store these values.

CompressAndWrite()[1/4] CompressAndWritePhoton.Compression.ElementCrusher Photon.Compression.ElementCrusherCompressAndWrite
void Photon.Compression.ElementCrusher.CompressAndWrite (Element e, byte[] buffer, ref int bitposition)
CompressAndWrite doesn't produce any temporary 40byte bitstream structs, but rather will compress and write directly to the supplied bitstream.
Use this rather than Write() and Compress() when you don't need the lossy or compressed value returned.

Quats can't cull upper bits, so its an all or nothing. Either the bits match or they don't

Rigidbody.MovePosition/MoveRotation only the enabled axes, leaving the disabled axes untouched.
Parameters
rb
e
ia
The indicated axis will be used (assuming they are enabled for the crusher). For example if an object only moves up and down in place, IncludedAxes.Y would only apply the Y axis compression values, and would leave the X and Z values as they currently are.

Element Photon.Compression.ElementCrusher.Read (ulong buffer, ref int bitposition, BitCullingLevel bcl = BitCullingLevel.NoCulling )
Deserialize a compressed element directly from the buffer stream into a vector3/quaternion.
This is the most efficient read, but it does not return any intermediary compressed values.
Parameters
buffer
Serialized source.
bitposition
Current read position in source.
bcl
Returns
